member.name: M:StudioForge.TotalMiner.API.ITMPluginProvider.GetPlugin
member.summary: Called by the game. Implemented by the mod. All mods must implement this method.
member.returns: An ITMPlugin implementation.

member.name: M:StudioForge.TotalMiner.API.ITMPluginProvider.GetPluginGUI
member.summary: Called by the game. Implemented by mods that provide custom GUI screens.

member.name: M:StudioForge.TotalMiner.API.ITMPluginProvider.GetPluginBlocks
member.summary: Called by the game. Implemented by mods that customize blocks.
member.returns: An ITMPluginBlocks implementation.

member.name: M:StudioForge.TotalMiner.API.ITMPluginProvider.GetPluginArcade
member.summary: Called by the game. Implemented by mods that supply arcade block games.
member.returns: An ITMPluginArcade implementation.

member.name: M:StudioForge.TotalMiner.API.ITMPluginProvider.GetPluginNet
member.summary: Called by the game. Implemented by mods that supply a networking server.

member.name: M:StudioForge.TotalMiner.API.ITMPlugin.Initialize(StudioForge.TotalMiner.API.ITMPluginManager,System.String)
member.summary: Initialize the Mod. This method is called by the game when the mod is first activated/loaded.
member.param: ITMPluginManager object.
The path of your Mods folder on disk relative to FileSystem.RootPath. Store and use this path if you require to read/write files from your Mods folder.

member.name: M:StudioForge.TotalMiner.API.ITMPlugin.InitializeGame(StudioForge.TotalMiner.API.ITMGame)
member.summary: This method is called by the game when the player has loaded a world.
member.param: ITMGame object.

member.name: M:StudioForge.TotalMiner.API.ITMPlugin.UnloadMod
member.summary: Called if the mod is unloaded.

member.name: M:StudioForge.TotalMiner.API.ITMPlugin.HandleInput(StudioForge.TotalMiner.API.ITMPlayer)
member.summary: This method is called by the game once every frame for every local player. Use this method to process user input.
member.returns: True if an input was processed.

member.name: M:StudioForge.TotalMiner.API.ITMPlugin.Update
member.summary: This method is called by the game once every frame. Use this method to add frame based logic that is not dependant on a particular player.

member.name: M:StudioForge.TotalMiner.API.ITMPlugin.Update(StudioForge.TotalMiner.API.ITMPlayer)
member.summary: This method is called by the game once every frame for every local and remote player in the game. Use this method to add player dependant frame based logic.

member.name: M:StudioForge.TotalMiner.API.ITMPlugin.Draw(StudioForge.TotalMiner.API.ITMPlayer,StudioForge.TotalMiner.API.ITMPlayer)
member.summary: This method is called by the game once every frame, after all the main rendering has been done. Use this method to add your own rendering.

member.name: M:StudioForge.TotalMiner.API.ITMPlugin.WorldSaved(System.Int32)
member.summary: This method is called by the game after the world has been saved to disk.
member.param: The version number of the save file.

member.name: M:StudioForge.TotalMiner.API.ITMPlugin.PlayerJoined(StudioForge.TotalMiner.API.ITMPlayer)
member.summary: This method is called once for each player that joins the game.

member.name: M:StudioForge.TotalMiner.API.ITMPlugin.PlayerLeft(StudioForge.TotalMiner.API.ITMPlayer)
member.summary: This method is called once for each player that leaves the game.

member.name: M:StudioForge.TotalMiner.API.ITMEnvManager.AddFog(StudioForge.BlockWorld.GlobalPoint3D,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Color,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Add a Fog section.
member.param: The center of the section.
The radius of the section.
The duration of the section in seconds.
The on/off transition duration time in seconds.
The intensity of the fog. Normalized. 0 = Weak. 1 = Opaque.
The color of the fog.
The view distance in blocks through the fog.
Transmit the section addition to remote gamers.

member.name: M:StudioForge.TotalMiner.API.ITMEnvManager.RemoveFog(StudioForge.BlockWorld.GlobalPoint3D,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Remove a Fog section.
member.param: The center of the section to remove.
Transmit the section removal to remote gamers.

member.summary: Add a Hail section.
member.param: The center of the section.
The radius of the section.
The duration of the section in seconds.
The on/off transition duration time in seconds.
The intensity of the hail. Normalized. 0 = Weak. 1 = Intense.
The color of the hail.
The minimum size of a hail stone in meters. e.g. 0.01 = 1 cm.
The maximum size of a hail stone in meters. e.g. 0.01 = 1 cm.
Transmit the section addition to remote gamers.

member.summary: Remove a Hail section.

Transmit the section removal to remote gamers.

member.summary: Called by a client to join an existing network session.

The gamer joining the session.
member.returns: A connected network session or null if coould not join.

member.summary: Called by the Host Gamer to create a new network session for others to join.

The gamer who is the host of the session (session creator).
Properties describing the session.
member.returns: A connected session or null if it could not be created.

member.name: M:StudioForge.TotalMiner.API.ITMNetworkManager.EndSession
member.summary: Called if the Host ends the current network session or the session is disconnected.

member.summary: Send a packet to a remote gamer. If recipient is null, send the packet to all remote gamers.
member.param: Packet to send.
Send options.
Gamer to receive the packet. If null all remote gamers in the session receive the packet.

member.name: M:StudioForge.TotalMiner.API.ITMNetworkManager.ReadData(StudioForge.Engine.Net.PacketReader,StudioForge.Engine.Net.NetworkGamer@)
member.summary: Fill a PacketReader with packet data intended for the local gamer.
member.param: The PacketReader stream to be filled with the packet data intended for the local gamer.
The gamer who sent the packet.
member.returns: True if there is still packets to read (from other senders). False if no more packets to read.

member.summary: Allows Mods to read and parse custom packets.
member.param: The gamer who sent the packet.
member.returns: Returns True if the packet was processed, false if not (a different mods packet).

member.name: P:StudioForge.TotalMiner.API.ITMNetworkManager.Session

member.summary: Set power on or off for a block at a position in the map. Any powered mechanism block at that position will react. Setting power on for a block that is already powered has no effect, likewise setting power off for a block that is not powered has no effect.

True (on) or False (off).
The player who powered the block or -1 if no player.

member.summary: Causes a block to start falling until it hits another block.

Update method.

member.name: M:StudioForge.TotalMiner.API.ITMWorld.TeleportEntities(StudioForge.BlockWorld.GlobalPoint3D,StudioForge.BlockWorld.GlobalPoint3D,StudioForge.BlockWorld.GlobalPoint3D,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Teleport all entities in an area to another position.
member.param: The minimum Tile position of the area.
The maximum Tile position of the area. Using both min and max, a cubic area is defined.
The destination Tile position to teleport the entities to.

False = all entities are teleported directly to tile position 'dest' regardless of their position in the area. True = all entities are teleported to a tile position relative to 'dest' and their original position relative to 'min'. e.g. final position = dest + (entity position - min)

member.name: P:StudioForge.TotalMiner.API.ITMWorld.Header
member.summary: Returns header data about the current world. This property returns a clone so that if you change a field on the object it does not effect the actual world header. For this reason it is best to cache this object and only call this getter again if it is critical to have any changes that might have been made since the last time you called the getter (such as a map rename).

member.summary: Adds an Action method that will be executed when a block is mined.

member.name: P:StudioForge.TotalMiner.API.ITMPlayer.SwingFacePos
member.summary: The quarter position of the reticle on the block face. A block face is divided into 4 quarters and a center quarter. Values 0 - 3 represent the 4 corner quarters. member.name: T:StudioForge.TotalMiner.API.ITMMap
member.summary: Total Miner maps are made up of regions. Each region is made up of chunks. Typically you don't have to deal directly with regions or chunks. Chunks are compressed in RAM using Run Length Encoded compression to minimize the games RAM footprint. If the data in a chunk is being edited (block id, light data, aux data), the chunk is first uncompressed into a plain x,y,z array. The array of chunk data is cached so multiple edits do not require subsequent uncompressions. The game releases the cache after some time of no edits. The game automatically handles the compression/uncompression/caching of chunk data. Typical Get methods such as GetBlockID, GetLight, GetAux will first check if an uncompressed cache of the chunk data exists, and if not, will uncompress the data and cache it, before returning the data you request. For the first uncompress this obviously has both time and RAM penalties. Subsequent calls will be fast, until the game releases the cache. For this reason it is not a good idea to access (uncompress) too many chunks at one time. RAM usage will sky rocket, potentially causing out of memory errors. For this reason there are Get...NoCache alternative methods for the Get methods. These NoCache methods will not uncompress/cache the chunk data while performing the query. If the chunk data is already uncompressed it will read from that, otherwise it will read directly from the RLE stream. Depending on the complexity of the stream, reads can be slower than reading from an uncompressed cache, but the RAM savings usually make up for that. Rule of thumb, if you are just doing the occasional queries for a few blocks, or you are querying blocks dispersed all over the map then then use the NoCache methods. If you are querying many blocks within a close proximity, use the Get methods.

member.name: M:StudioForge.TotalMiner.API.ITMMap.Commit
member.summary: Force mesh rebuilds after map block changes.

member.name: M:StudioForge.TotalMiner.API.ITMMap.IsValidPoint(StudioForge.BlockWorld.GlobalPoint3D)
member.summary: Check if a voxel location is within the loaded bounds of a map.
member.param: Voxel location
member.returns: True if the location is within the map bounds, otherwise false.

member.name: M:StudioForge.TotalMiner.API.ITMMap.GetPoint(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector3)
member.summary: Get an integral voxel location from a map position vector.

member.name: M:StudioForge.TotalMiner.API.ITMMap.GetPosition(StudioForge.BlockWorld.GlobalPoint3D)
member.summary: Get a map position vector from an integral voxel location.
member.returns: The top north west corner of the voxel location.

member.name: M:StudioForge.TotalMiner.API.ITMMap.GetBlockCenter(StudioForge.BlockWorld.GlobalPoint3D)
member.summary: Get a map position vector from an integral voxel location.
member.returns: The center of the voxel location.

member.name: M:StudioForge.TotalMiner.API.ITMMap.GetBlockID(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector3)
member.summary: Get the Block ID at a map position. If there is no uncompressed cache for the chunk that contains the block, the chunk is uncompressed and cached before the Block ID is read. This will be a slow operation if the chunk is not already uncompressed and will consume 32 x 32 x 32 bytes of RAM, but subsequent calls will be faster, until the cache is discarded by the game.

member.name: M:StudioForge.TotalMiner.API.ITMMap.GetBlockID(StudioForge.BlockWorld.GlobalPoint3D)
member.summary: Get the Block ID at an integral voxel location. If there is no uncompressed cache for the chunk that contains the block, the chunk is uncompressed and cached before the Block ID is read. This will be a slow operation if the chunk is not already uncompressed and will consume 32 x 32 x 32 bytes of RAM, but subsequent calls will be faster, until the cache is discarded by the game.

member.name: M:StudioForge.TotalMiner.API.ITMMap.GetBlockIDNoCache(StudioForge.BlockWorld.GlobalPoint3D)
member.summary: Get the Block ID at an integral voxel location. If there is no uncompressed cache for the chunk that contains the block, Block ID is read from the compressed stream. This call will not consume RAM to store a cache, and will not cause a chunk uncompression, so there is no first up penalty if the chunk not uncompressed. But generally, reading Block ID's from an uncompressed stream is slower than reading Block ID's from a compressed cache. It depends how complex the chunk is. If you plan to only make a few reads from the chunk, this method should be fine. If you plan to make hundreds or thousands of reads, it might be better to use the method that uncompresses and caches the chunk.

member.name: M:StudioForge.TotalMiner.API.ITMMap.GetBlockData(StudioForge.BlockWorld.GlobalPoint3D)
member.summary: Get the Block ID, Light and Aux data at an integral voxel location. If there is no uncompressed cache for the chunk that contains the block, the chunk is uncompressed and cached before the Block data is read. This will be a slow operation if the chunk is not already uncompressed and will consume 32 x 32 x 32 x 3 bytes of RAM, but subsequent calls will be faster, until the cache is discarded by the game.

member.name: M:StudioForge.TotalMiner.API.ITMMap.GetBlockIDAndAux(StudioForge.BlockWorld.GlobalPoint3D)
member.summary: Get the Block ID and Aux data at an integral voxel location. This method is slightly faster than calling GetBlockID and GetAuxData separately, and is faster than calling GetBlockData. If there is no uncompressed cache for the chunk that contains the block, the chunk is uncompressed and cached before the Block data is read.

member.name: M:StudioForge.TotalMiner.API.ITMMap.GetBlockIDAndAuxNoCache(StudioForge.BlockWorld.GlobalPoint3D)
member.summary: Get the Block ID and Aux data at an integral voxel location. This method is slightly faster than calling GetBlockIDNoCache and GetAuxDataNoCache separately. If there is no uncompressed cache for the chunk that contains the block, Block ID and Aux is read from the compressed streams.

member.name: M:StudioForge.TotalMiner.API.ITMMap.GetBlockAndLight(StudioForge.BlockWorld.GlobalPoint3D)
member.summary: Get the Block ID and Light data at an integral voxel location. This method is slightly faster than calling GetBlockID and GetBlockLight separately, and is faster than calling GetBlockData. If there is no uncompressed cache for the chunk that contains the block, the chunk is uncompressed and cached before the Block data is read.

member.summary: Compares if the block data at a map position matches inputs.
member.param: The map position of the block to compare.
The Block ID to compare.
The Aux data to compare.
member.returns: True of the Block ID and Aux data at the map position matches the blockID and aux parameters above.

member.name: M:StudioForge.TotalMiner.API.ITMMap.GetBlockInventory(StudioForge.BlockWorld.GlobalPoint3D,StudioForge.Engine.GamerServices.GamerID,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Get a blocks ITMInventory object. Certain types of blocks in the game have inventory, such as chests, safes, etc.
member.param: Voxel location
ID of gamer who owns the block inventory. Only valid for locked chests. If the block at the location is not a locked chest, pass in GamerID.Sys1
By default, if the blocks inventory is empty, this method will return null. If you require the inventory object even if it is empty, pass TRUE, otherwise pass FALSE.

member.name: M:StudioForge.TotalMiner.API.ITMMap.GetOrAddDataBlock(StudioForge.BlockWorld.GlobalPoint3D)
member.summary: Get the data block associated with a block id at a voxel location. If the data block doesn't exist, create it. Some blocks require extra data, such as chests for inventory. Data blocks are used to store this extra data.
member.param: Voxel location.

member.name: P:StudioForge.TotalMiner.API.ITMMap.TileSize
member.summary: The size of a map tile (in meters).
